questions.question_text_1: Which of the following is/are false statement(s) regarding C programming language?
question_texts: Which of the following is/are false statement(s) regarding C programming language?

options.option_text: It is an imperative programming language.
It is not a structured programming language.
It is a dynamically typed programming language.
The language uses curly braces ({ }) to define the scope of a for loop.

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following statement(s) is/are true regarding ASCII and Unicode?
question_texts: Which of the following statement(s) is/are true regarding ASCII and Unicode?

options.option_text: ASCII uses 6 bits to encode a given character.
UTF-16 and UTF-32 are both variable length encoding techniques.
UTF-8 is a fixed length encoding technique.

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following is/are valid identifiers in C language?
question_texts: Which of the following is/are valid identifiers in C language?

questions.question_text_1: In split memory architecture, what is the purpose of cache memory?
question_texts: In split memory architecture, what is the purpose of cache memory?

options.option_text: To temporarily store frequently used data for fast access

questions.question_text_1: What is the primary function of the Program Counter in a CPU?
question_texts: What is the primary function of the Program Counter in a CPU?

options.option_text: Keep track of the currently executing instruction

questions.question_text_1: Consider the following steps to compute the minimum among three numbers. Load the three numbers from memory locations M[0], M[1] and M[2] and store the maximum number in M[3].

questions.question_text_2: Consider the below C program.    The above C program is used to calculate the sum of individual digits of a number. For ex: If the value given to the variable “n” is 25, the sum of individual digits will be 7.  Fill in the placeholders “Expression1” and “Expression2” to ensure that the program functions correctly.
